article.headline: Niagara 84, Loyola MD 73
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- David Brooks scored 27 points to lead Niagara to an 84-73 win over Loyola on Sunday. Trailing 66-65, Barry Durosier ignited a 9-0 Niagara run when he hit a 3-pointer with 8:06 remaining in the second half. Niagara (13-6) held Loyola scoreless for nearly four minutes during the run, allowing the Purple Eagles to take the lead for good in a game that had 14 lead changes and eight ties. A 3-pointer by Freddie Stanback brought Loyola within three at 76-73 with 3:02 remaining, but Brooks answered on the next Niagara possession with a 3-pointer. The Purple Eagles held the Greyhounds off the scoreboard for the rest of the game. Alvin Cruz scored 17 points and Juan Mendez added 15 points and 12 rebounds for Niagara, which won its 14th straight time at home. Sean Corrigan led Loyola (3-16) with 16 points. Bernard Allen had 15 and Shane James 10.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
